summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and attorney Jeffrey L. Jocks regarding a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts. The prosecutors are seeking records of any tuition payments made by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities for students at Interlochen. Jocks confirms Interlochen has no such records as they only keep payment information for 7 years.

persons.name: Jeffrey L. Jocks
persons.role: Attorney for Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts in responding to a federal subpoena from the SDNY regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. He communicates that Interlochen has no records of Epstein-related tuition payments.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who sends the initial subpoena and follow-up inquiries regarding records of tuition payments from Jeffrey Epstein or his entities to Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.context: Attorney cc'd on the email chain, presumably also involved in the legal response to the subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and convicted sex offender. The subpoena seeks records of any tuition payments he or his entities made to Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Associate of Jeffrey Epstein, convicted for her role in his sex trafficking scheme. The subpoena also seeks information related to her.

connections.description: Attorney-client correspondence regarding a federal subpoena. Jocks represents Interlochen Center for the Arts and is responding to inquiries from AUSA Maurene.
Both are attorneys involved in the legal response to the subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts, as indicated by being cc'd on the same email.
Both are named as subjects of the federal subpoena seeking records from Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Interlochen
events.description: Assistant United States Attorney Maurene sends a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Final Response on Subpoena
events.description: Attorney Jeffrey L. Jocks provides a final response confirming Interlochen Center for the Arts has no records of tuition payments by Epstein or his entities, as they only keep such information for 7 years.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts (presumably in Interlochen, Michigan)
Traverse City, Michigan 49684 (Jeffrey L. Jocks' law office)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking records of any tuition payments made by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities.
The subpoena also sought information related to Ghislaine Maxwell.
Interlochen's attorney, Jeffrey L. Jocks, confirmed the institution only keeps tuition payment records for 7 years and had no records reflecting payments by Epstein or Epstein entities.
The email chain shows follow-up inquiries from prosecutors in April and October 2020 after an initial subpoena in February 2020.
The correspondence emphasizes the confidential nature of the subpoena request.
